WTF. GUYS. Stop teaching kids that they have no say in what they do or who they sit with/on or how they feel.
Quite frankly, it's the consent thing that peeves me most..."LOOK AT THIS FRIENDLY OLD MAN IN A RED SUIT WITH WHITE HAIR! GO SIT WITH HIM!"
Seriously. What does this teach children about consent? About their ability to be wise and strong and independent/autonomous humans someday?
when it is against your will, and incites fear/terror AND isn't for your benefit or wellbeing, is deeply problematic in my mind.
Children already lack autonomy on many/most levels, and having the people upon whom your entire life depends tell you to do something...
I have a small grievance to air around children being encouraged/forced to sit on santa's lap at Christmas time...
